page.title: 07WARKWORTH HALL FARM,TWYFORD.
page.content: CORN AND BARLEY ARE GROWN,DRIED AND SOLD.IN ADDITION TO THE 2 HAY BARNS AND 1 CATTLE BARN,A NEW BARN HAS BEEN BUILT TO DRY THE CROPS TO THE REQUIRED MOISTURE LEVEL.DUE TO THE WET WEATHER THIS YEAR IT TOOK LONGER THAN USUAL TO DO THIS.{THE MACHINES}THEY OWN 3 TRACTORS,1 LANDROVER AND 1 COMBINE HARVESTER.{THE PONDS}THERE WAS JUST OVER HALF AN ACRE OF VERY WET LAND,SO THEY DUG IT OUT LEAVING AN ISLAND IN THE MIDDLE.IT WAS LEFT TO FILL WITH RAIN WATER AND SELF-POPULATE.IT IS NOW STOCKED WITH TROUT AND USED FOR FISHING.IN THE 1960'S THE RAILWAY THAT CUT THROUGH THE FARM WAS TAKEN OUT.THE OWNERS BOUGHT BACK THE LAND THAT USED TO BELONG TO THE FARM.ALTHOUGH THE LAND WASN'T ANY USE FOR FARMING,IT DID ALLOW EASIER ACCESS TO THE FIELDS ACROSS THE LINE.THE EMBANKMENTS HAVE POPULATED THEMSELVES WITH WILDLIFE.
